abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            stronger banking systems for the Vietnam's rural poor.
            In Vietnam three-quarters of the whole population and 85
            percent of the poor lived in rural areas. Because of the
            small size of farms, agricultural growth needed to be
            combined with non-farm employment to make a sustained attack
            on rural poverty. The flow of term lending to the rural
            areas was insufficient to meet the investment needed to
            increase output and to lift a large proportion of the rural
            population out of poverty. The Second Rural Finance Project
            was implemented between 2003 and 2009 to spur rural
            investments throughout Vietnam. As a result, the income of
            the rural population rose by 65 percent and generated an
            estimated 2.74 million additional jobs. Finally, the project
            also led to the improvement in financial services and risk
            and credit management systems.
